8.verse: Nevertheless, God saved them for the honor of His name so He could show His power to the world.

9.verse: He gave the order, and the waters of the Red Sea dried up, and He led the people across the sea floor as though it were the wilderness.

10.verse: That’s how He liberated them from their enemies and rescued them from the hand of their oppressors.

11.verse: After that the sea surged and covered their foes, and every one of them drowned in its waters.

12.verse: When God’s people saw what He did, they believed what He said and they sang praises to Him.

13.verse: But it didn’t take long for them to forget what He had done. They moved on without waiting for His instructions,

14.verse: So our ancestors became very hungry in the wilderness and the rabble grumbled and complained, testing God’s patience in the desert.

15.verse: Although He granted their request, He also sent a disease that caused them to waste away.

16.verse: While they were camped in the desert, some began to be jealous of Moses and Aaron, the holy priest of the Eternal.

17.verse: The earth opened up, and a deep fissure swallowed Dathan and buried Abiram’s group.

18.verse: A blaze ignited where they were gathered; the fire consumed the wicked mob.

19.verse: The people made a golden calf in Horeb and bowed to worship an image they had made.

20.verse: They traded the glory of God for the likeness of an ox that eats grass.

21.verse: They forgot about God, their True Savior, who had done great things for them in Egypt—

22.verse: Miracles in the land of Ham and amazing deeds at the Red Sea.

23.verse: Therefore, He declared in His anger that He would wipe them away. If Moses, His chosen one, Had not pleaded for the people, His anger would have destroyed them.

24.verse: At the edge of the beautiful land God had promised them, they didn’t trust His words, so they refused to enter.

25.verse: They complained when they were gathered in their tents; they ignored the voice of the Eternal.

26.verse: Because of their attitude, He swore, “I’ll leave you where you fall in the desert.

27.verse: I’ll scatter your children—whoever is left— throughout the nations all over the earth.”

28.verse: Then they aligned themselves with the god of Peor, and they ate sacrifices that had been made to lifeless gods.

29.verse: Through their actions, they stirred up His anger, and a plague broke out in their midst.

30.verse: Then Phinehas took a stand and intervened, so the plague was stopped.

31.verse: And God saw what he did and considered him righteous, a man to be honored by all generations forever.

32.verse: Again they stirred up His anger at the waters of Meribah, and serious trouble came to Moses because of them;

33.verse: Because they stood against the Spirit, Moses spoke rashly with them.

34.verse: Later, after they entered the promised land, they did not eradicate the peoples, as the Eternal had ordered them to do,

35.verse: But they mixed and married with the outsider nations, adopted their practices,

36.verse: And worshiped their idols, which entrapped them.

37.verse: They even offered their sons and daughters as sacrifices to the demons.

38.verse: The promised land was corrupted by the innocent blood they offered to the idols of Canaan, The blood of their very own sons and daughters.

39.verse: They became impure because of their unfaithful works; by their actions, they prostituted themselves to other gods.

40.verse: Therefore the Eternal’s anger was ignited against His people; He came to despise the people of His inheritance.

41.verse: So He handed them over to the control of foreign nations, to be ruled by people who hated them.

42.verse: Their enemies exploited them, victimized them, and restrained them by abusive power.

43.verse: He delivered them over and over again; however, they were slow to learn and deliberately rebelled. Their sins humbled them and nearly destroyed them.

44.verse: Nevertheless, He saw their great struggle, took pity on them, and heard their prayers;

45.verse: He did not forget His covenant promises to them but reversed their fortune and released them from their punishment because of His loyal love.

46.verse: He changed the hearts of all who held them captive so that they would show compassion on them.

47.verse: Save us, O Eternal One our God, and gather us who are scattered among all the nations, That we may give thanks to Your holy name and celebrate Your amazing greatness with praise.

48.verse: Blessed be the Eternal, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. And let everyone say, “Amen!” Praise the Eternal!

1.verse: Book Five - Book Five (Psalms 107–150) succinctly presents many of the major themes of the previous psalms. It tracks along Israel’s history as God’s nation, from the united monarchy, through the exile, to the restoration. Psalm 107 is a song of thanksgiving composed by those who survived exile and made their way home. As in Isaiah, the return from exile is described as a new exodus. Three Davidic psalms toward the beginning of Book Five represent the monarchy and recall Israel’s golden age. The Songs for the Journey to Worship (Psalm 120–134) are composed for use by God’s people as they traveled from their homes up to Zion to worship God at the temple. Representing their time in exile are songs of lament, heartbreaking testimonies to individuals’ pain when they are crushed by their enemies and separated from God’s blessings. Finally, Book Five concludes the collection by offering praise and thanks to God, for the story of Israel does not end with its exile and separation; rather, it ends in restoration and hope. Those who edited and compiled the Book of Psalms were relieved to be back in the land of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—rebuilding their temple and reestablishing their connection with God. Psalm 107 - Erupt with thanks to the Eternal, for He is good and His loyal love lasts forever.

2.verse: Let all those redeemed by the Eternal— those rescued from times of deep trouble—join in giving thanks.

3.verse: He has gathered them across the earth, from east and west, from [north and south].

4.verse: Some drifted around in the desert and found no place where they could live.

5.verse: Their bellies growled with hunger; their mouths were dry with thirst; their souls grew weak and weary.

6.verse: In their distress, they called out to the Eternal, and He saved them from their misery.

7.verse: He showed them the best path; then He led them down the right road until they arrived at an inhabited town.

8.verse: May they erupt with praise and give thanks to the Eternal in honor of His loyal love And all the wonders He has performed for humankind!

9.verse: He has quenched their thirst, and He has satisfied their hunger with what is good.

10.verse: Some people were locked up in dark prisons, confined in gloom as bleak as death. They were captives bound by iron chains and misery,

11.verse: All because they had rebelled against the directives of the True God and had rejected the wisdom of the Most High.

12.verse: So they suffered the heaviness of slave labor; when they stumbled and fell, there was no one to help them up.

13.verse: In their distress, they called out to the Eternal; He saved them from their misery.

14.verse: He rescued them from the darkness, delivered them from the deepest gloom of death; He shattered their iron chains.

15.verse: May they erupt with praise and give thanks to the Eternal in honor of His loyal love And all the wonders He has performed for humankind!

16.verse: He has broken down the bronze gates and severed the iron bars that imprisoned them.

17.verse: Some people became fools infected by their rebellious ways, and sickness followed because of their sins.

18.verse: Afflicted and weak, they refused any sort of food as they approached the gates of death.

19.verse: In their distress, they called out to the Eternal, and He saved them from their misery.

20.verse: He gave the order and healed them and rescued them from certain death.

21.verse: May they erupt with praise and give thanks to the Eternal in honor of His loyal love And all the wonders He has performed for humankind!

22.verse: Let them present to Him thanksgiving sacrifices and tell stories of His great deeds through songs of joy.

23.verse: Some set out to sea in ships, traveling across mighty seas in order to trade in foreign lands.

24.verse: They witnessed the powerful acts of the Eternal, marveled at the great wonders He revealed over the deep waters.

25.verse: For He spoke and summoned a violent wind that whipped up the waves of the sea.

26.verse: Relentless waves lifted the ships high in the sky, then drove them down to the depths; the sailors’ courage dissolved into misery.

27.verse: They staggered and stumbled around like drunkards, and they had no idea what to do.

28.verse: In their distress, they called out to the Eternal, and He saved them from their misery.

29.verse: He commanded the storm to calm down, and it became still. A hush came over the waves of the sea,

30.verse: The sailors were delighted at the quiet, and He guided them to their port.

31.verse: May they erupt with praise and give thanks to the Eternal in honor of His loyal love And all the wonders He has performed for humankind!

32.verse: Let them glorify Him in the assembly of His people and worship Him in the presence of the elders.

33.verse: God transforms wild, flowing rivers into dry, lonely deserts, lively springs of water into thirsty ground.

34.verse: He turns lush gardens into lifeless wastelands, all because of the wickedness of those who reside there.

35.verse: Yet He transforms a dry, lonely desert into pools of living water, parched ground into lively springs.

36.verse: And He allows those who are hungry to live there so that they might build a livable city.

37.verse: There they sow fields and plant vineyards and gather up an abundant harvest.

38.verse: He anoints them with His blessings, and they greatly increase in number. He does not allow their herds to dwindle.

39.verse: When His people lessen in number and are humbled through persecution, suffering, and brokenheartedness,

40.verse: He pours out contempt on those responsible leaders and then makes them drift around in an uncharted wasteland.

41.verse: But He raises the poor away from their suffering and multiplies their families like a flock.

42.verse: The righteous see God’s actions, and they take delight in what He does, but the unrighteous don’t dare to speak.

43.verse: Is there anyone wise? If so, may the wise take notice of these things and reflect upon the loyal love of the Eternal.

1.verse: Psalm 108 - A song of David. My heart is committed, O God: I will sing; I will sing praises with great affection and pledge my whole soul to the singing.

2.verse: Wake up the harp and lyre, and strum the strings; I will stir the sleepy dawn from slumber!

3.verse: I will stand and offer You my thanks, Eternal One, in the presence of others; I will sing of Your greatness among the nations no matter where I am.

4.verse: For Your amazing love soars overhead far into the heavens; Your truth rises up to the clouds where passing light bends.

5.verse: O God, that You would be lifted up above the heavens in the hearts of Your people until the whole earth knows Your glory.

6.verse: Reach down and rescue those whom You love; pull us to safety by Your mighty right hand, and answer me.

7.verse: God’s voice has been heard in His holy sanctuary: “I will celebrate. I will allocate Shechem and the Succoth Valley to My people.

8.verse: Gilead belongs to Me, and so does Manasseh; Ephraim is the helmet that protects My head; Judah is the scepter through which I rule;

9.verse: Moab is the washpot in which I clean Myself; I will throw My shoe over Edom in conquest; Philistia will soon hear My victory shout.”

10.verse: But who will take me into the fortified city? Who will lead me into Edom?

11.verse: Have You not turned Your back on us, O God? Will You stay away and not accompany our armies, O God?

12.verse: Help us against our enemy; we need Your help! It’s useless to trust in the hand of man for liberation.

13.verse: Only through God can we be successful. It is God alone who will defeat our enemies and bring us victory!

1.verse: Psalm 109 - For the worship leader. A song of David. O True God of my every praise, do not keep silent!

2.verse: My enemies have opened their wicked, deceit-filled mouths and blown their foul breath on me. They have slandered me with their twisted tongues

3.verse: And unleashed loathsome words that swirl around me. Though I have done nothing, they attack me.

4.verse: Though I offer them love and keep them in my prayers, they accuse me;

5.verse: Though I treat them well, they answer me with evil; though I give them love, they reply with a gesture of hatred.

6.verse: Here’s what they say: Find some evil scoundrel to go after him. Let’s get some accuser to level charges against him.

7.verse: At his trial, let’s make sure he is found guilty so that even his prayers become evidence that convicts him.

8.verse: Let his days be few, his life cut short; let another take over his position.

9.verse: Lay waste to his family— let his children become orphans and his wife a widow.

10.verse: Let his children wander the streets—his legacy, homeless beggars scavenging for food, [driven out of] the rubble and slums where they live.

11.verse: Let the bankers take what is his; strangers help themselves to what little is left of all he’s earned.

12.verse: Let there be no one around to offer him compassion, nor anyone to give his fatherless children warmth or kindness.

13.verse: Let his family line come to an end— no future generations to carry on his name!

14.verse: Let the sins of his fathers be remembered before the Eternal, and the sins of his mother never be erased.

15.verse: Let their offenses always be before the Eternal so that the memory of this family is long forgotten by all the people of the earth,

16.verse: Because it never occurred to him to show compassion; instead, he oppressed the poor, afflicted, and brokenhearted and sent them to their death.

17.verse: He loved to invoke a curse—so let his curses come back to him. He preferred not to speak a blessing—so let all blessings be far from him.

18.verse: He wrapped himself with cursing, draped around him like a cape; may it flood his body like water and seep into his bones like oil.

19.verse: Let those curses wrap around him like a cloak on a cold night, like a belt tightly knotted around him every day.

20.verse: Let the Eternal so reward my accusers, all those who speak and plot evil against me.

21.verse: But You, my Master, the Eternal, treat me with kindness for the sake of Your name, the good of Your reputation; because Your unfailing love is so good, O deliver me!

22.verse: You see, I am poor and needy, and my heart is broken inside me.

23.verse: My life is fading away like a shadow that vanishes in the evening; I am like a locust easily brushed off the shoulder.

24.verse: I can barely stand; my knees are weak from not eating; I am haggard and drawn, just skin and bones.

25.verse: I have become a person of contempt to my accusers; whenever they see me, they taunt me, shaking their heads in disapproval.

26.verse: Help me, Eternal One my God; come to my rescue! Save me through Your unfailing love.

27.verse: Let everyone know that You are the source of my salvation that You, Eternal One, have done this mighty work.

28.verse: Let them utter a curse, if they will, but You will speak a blessing; [when they come to attack,] let them know utter shame. Then Your servant will celebrate and praise You!

29.verse: Let my enemies be clothed with disgrace and humiliation; let them be dressed in a robe of their own shame.

30.verse: I will continually give thanks to the Eternal with the praises of my mouth; I will praise Him in the company of many.

31.verse: For He always stands in support of the afflicted and needy to rescue their souls from those who judge and condemn them.

1.verse: Psalm 110 - A song of David. Psalm 110 may have been written to celebrate the coronation of one of David’s sons as king. The Eternal invites the royal son of David to take his rightful place at His right hand, the place of power and authority—not just over Jerusalem but over his enemies as well. But the royal son is to be more than a king, he is to be a priest according the order of that mysterious and enigmatic figure, Melchizedek (Genesis 14:17-24). God promises to give this royal priest-king victory over his enemies as he marches out to war. This psalm is the psalm most quoted by early Christian writers in the New Testament. As they considered the significance of Jesus, they found that this psalm, more than any, expressed their conviction that the risen Jesus now occupies a unique place at God’s right hand and will be victorious over His enemies. The Eternal said to my lord, “Sit here at My right hand, in the place of honor and power, And I will gather your enemies together, lead them in on hands and knees; you will rest your feet on their backs.”

2.verse: The Eternal will extend your reach as you rule from your throne on Zion. You will be out in enemy lands, ruling.

3.verse: Your people will come as volunteers that day; they will be a sight to see: on that day, you will lead your army, noble in their holiness. As the new day dawns and dew settles on the grass, your young volunteers will make their way to you.

4.verse: The Eternal has sworn an oath and cannot change His mind: “You are a priest forever— in the honored order of Melchizedek.”

5.verse: The lord is at Your right hand; on the day that his fury comes to its peak, he will crush kings.

6.verse: You will see the dead in heaps at the roadside, corpses spread far and wide in valleys and on hillsides. Rulers and military leaders will lie among them without distinction. This will be his judgment on the nations.

7.verse: There is a brook along the way. He will stop there and drink; And when he is finished, he will raise his head.

1.verse: Psalm 111 - Praise the Eternal. I will thank Him with all my heart in the presence of the right-standing and with the assembly.

2.verse: The works of the Eternal are many and wondrous! They are examined by all who delight in them.

3.verse: His work is marked with beauty and majesty; His justice has no end.

4.verse: His wonders are reminders that the Eternal is gracious and compassionate to all.

5.verse: He provides food to those who revere Him. He will always remember His covenant.

6.verse: He has shown the mighty strength of His works to His people by giving the land of foreign nations to them.

7.verse: All His accomplishments are truth and justice; all His instructions are certain.

8.verse: His precepts will continue year in and year out, performed by His people with honesty and truth.

9.verse: He has redeemed His people, guaranteeing His covenant forever. His name is holy and awe-inspiring.

10.verse: Reverence for the Eternal is the first step toward wisdom. All those who worship Him have a good understanding. His praise will echo through eternity!

1.verse: Psalm 112 - Praise the Eternal! How blessed are those who revere the Eternal, who turn from evil and take great pleasure in His commandments.

2.verse: Their children will be a powerful force upon the earth; this generation that does what is right in God’s eyes will be blessed.

3.verse: His house will be stocked with wealth and riches, and His love for justice will endure for all time.

4.verse: When life is dark, a light will shine for those who live rightly— those who are merciful, compassionate, and strive for justice.

5.verse: Good comes to all who are gracious and share freely; they conduct their affairs with sound judgment.

6.verse: Nothing will ever rattle them; the just will always be remembered.

7.verse: They will not be afraid when the news is bad because they have resolved to trust in the Eternal.

8.verse: Their hearts are confident, and they are fearless, for they expect to see their enemies defeated.

9.verse: They give freely to the poor; their righteousness endures for all time; their strength and power is established in honor.

10.verse: The wicked will be infuriated when they see the good man honored! They will clench their teeth and dissolve to nothing; and when they go, their wicked desires will follow.

1.verse: Psalm 113 - Psalms 113–118 comprise an important unit called the Hallel, which in Hebrew means “praise.” Composed after the exile, these six psalms are recited together by observant Jews during some of the major holidays on the Jewish calendar. The Gospel writers tell us that Jesus and His disciples sang a song following their last meal together, which was the Passover (Matthew 26:30; Mark 14:26). That may have been the Hallel. Praise the Eternal! All of you who call yourselves the children of the Eternal, come and praise His name. Lift Him high to the high place in your hearts.

2.verse: At this moment, and for all the moments yet to come, may the Eternal’s name ascend in the hearts of His people.

3.verse: At every time and in every place— from the moment the sun rises to the moment the sun sets— may the name of the Eternal be high in the hearts of His people.

4.verse: The Eternal is seated high above every nation. His glory fills the skies.

5.verse: To whom should we compare the Eternal, our God? No one. From His seat, high above,

6.verse: He deigns to observe the earth and her thin skies, stooping even to see her goings on, far beneath His feet.

7.verse: He gathers up the poor from their dirt floors, pulls the needy from the trash heaps,

8.verse: And places them among heads of state, seated next to the rulers of His people where they cannot be ignored.

9.verse: Into the home of the childless bride, He sends children who are, for her, a cause of happiness beyond measure. Praise the Eternal!

1.verse: Psalm 114 - When the time came for Israel to leave Egypt— for Jacob’s family to be free of those who spoke another language—

2.verse: God chose to make Judah His sacred place, and Israel became His realm.

3.verse: And the waters of the sea witnessed God’s actions and ran away; the Jordan, too, turned around and ran back to where it came from.

4.verse: All of the mountains leapt with the strength of mighty rams, and all of the hills danced with the joy of little lambs.

5.verse: Why do you retreat, O sea? Why do you roll back your waters, O Jordan?

6.verse: Why, O mountains, do you leap with the strength of rams? Why, O hills, do you dance with joy like little lambs?

7.verse: Shudder and quake, O you earth, at the sight of the Lord. The God of Jacob comes,

8.verse: Who turns rock into pools of refreshing water and flint into fountains of life-giving streams!

1.verse: Psalm 115 - Not for us, O Eternal One; this glory is not for us—but for Your name because of Your loyal love and truth.

2.verse: Why should the nations ask, “Where is their God now?”

3.verse: Our God is in heaven doing whatever He chooses.

4.verse: Those nations worship idols of silver and gold, crafted by human hands:

5.verse: They have given their gods mouths, but they cannot speak; eyes, but they cannot see.

6.verse: They have provided their idols with ears, but they cannot hear; noses, but they cannot smell.

7.verse: They have fashioned hands, but the idols cannot reach out and touch; feet, but they cannot walk. Their idols cannot make a sound in their finely crafted throats.

8.verse: The people who make idols will become useless like them, like all who trust in idols.

9.verse: O Israel, put your trust in the Eternal. He is their helper and defender.

10.verse: O family of Aaron, put your trust in the Eternal. He is their helper and defender.

11.verse: All who fear and know the Eternal, put your trust in Him. He is their helper and defender.

12.verse: The Eternal has remembered us, and He will bless us. He will bless the people of Israel. He will bless the priestly family of Aaron.

13.verse: The Eternal will bless those who worship and stand in awe of Him, from the least to the greatest.

14.verse: May the Eternal prosper your family, growing both you and your descendants.

15.verse: May the blessings of the Eternal, maker of heaven and earth, be on you.

16.verse: The heavens above belong to the Eternal, and yet earth in all of its beauty has been given to humanity by Him.

17.verse: The dead do not praise the Eternal, nor do any who descend into the silent grave.

18.verse: But we will praise and bless You—our Eternal One— today and forever. Praise the Eternal!

1.verse: Psalm 116 - I love the Eternal; for not only does He hear my voice, my pleas for mercy,

2.verse: But He leaned down when I was in trouble and brought His ear close to me. So as long as I have breath, I will call on Him.

3.verse: Once I was wound in the wrappings of death; the terror of dying and the grave had a grip on me; I could not get away, for I was entombed in distress and sorrow.

4.verse: Then I called on the name of the Eternal: “O Eternal One—I am begging You—save me!”

5.verse: The Eternal is full of grace and naturally just; our God is compassionate and merciful.

6.verse: And the Eternal watches over the naive. Whenever I was knocked down, He reached down and saved me.

7.verse: O my soul! Return and relax. Come to your true rest, for the Eternal has showered you with His favor.

8.verse: God, You alone rescued my soul from the grips of death, my eyes from weeping, and my feet from slipping.

9.verse: I will come before the Eternal as long as I journey in the land of the living.

10.verse: I believed Your promise; therefore I spoke, “I am in deep trouble.”

11.verse: In my confusion I blurted out, “All people are liars!”

12.verse: How will I pay back the Eternal for all His graciousness toward me?

13.verse: I will raise the cup of deliverance and call out the name of the Eternal.

14.verse: I will fulfill the promises I made to Him here as a witness to all His people.

15.verse: Precious in the eyes of the Eternal are the deaths of those who follow after Him.

16.verse: O Eternal One, You know I am Your servant. I am Your servant, a child of Your maidservant, devoted to You; You have cut me loose from the chains of death that bind me.

17.verse: And I come, eager to offer a sacrifice of gratitude and call on the name of the Eternal.

18.verse: I will fulfill the promises I made to Him here as a witness to all His people

19.verse: In the courts of the Eternal’s temple, among the people of God’s city, O Jerusalem. Praise the Eternal!

1.verse: Psalm 117 - Praise the Eternal, all nations. Raise your voices, all people.

2.verse: For His unfailing love is great, and it is intended for us, and His faithfulness to His promises knows no end. Praise the Eternal!

1.verse: Psalm 118 - Give thanks to the Eternal because He is always good. He never ceases to be loving and kind.

2.verse: Let the people of Israel proclaim: “He never ceases to be loving and kind.”

3.verse: Let the priests of Aaron’s line proclaim: “He never ceases to be loving and kind.”

4.verse: Let the people who fear the Eternal proclaim: “He never ceases to be loving and kind.”

5.verse: When trouble surrounded me, I cried out to the Eternal; He answered me and brought me to a wide, open space.

6.verse: The Eternal is with me, so I will not be afraid of anything. If God is on my side, how can anyone hurt me?

7.verse: The Eternal is on my side, a champion for my cause; so when I look at those who hate me, victory will be in sight.

8.verse: It is better to put your faith in the Eternal for your security than to trust in people.

9.verse: It is better to put your faith in Him for your security than to trust in princes.

10.verse: All these nations surround me, squeezing me from all sides; with the name of the Eternal, I will destroy them.

11.verse: They rose up against me, squeezed me from all sides, yes, from all sides; with the name of the Eternal, I will destroy them.

12.verse: They surrounded me like a swarm of bees; they were destroyed quickly and thoroughly— Flaring up like a pile of thorns— with the name of the Eternal, I will destroy them.

13.verse: I was pushed back, attacked so that I was about to fall, but the Eternal was there to help me keep my balance.

14.verse: He is my strength, and He is the reason I sing; He has been there to save me in every situation.

15.verse: In the tents of the righteous soldiers of God, there are shouts of joy and victory. They sing: “The right hand of the Eternal has shown His power.

16.verse: The mighty arm of the Eternal is raised in victory; the right hand of His has shown His power.”

17.verse: I will not die. I will live. I will live to tell about all the Eternal has done.

18.verse: The Eternal has taught me many lessons; He has been strict and severe, but even in His discipline, He has not allowed me to die.

19.verse: Early Christians found in the words of this psalm a wonderful way of describing the significance of Jesus. He was the rejected stone whom God made the cornerstone of a brand-new temple (verses 22–24). Open wide to me the gates of justice so that I may walk through them and offer praise and worship to the Eternal.

20.verse: This is the gate of the Eternal; the righteous children of God will go through it.

21.verse: I will praise You because You answered me when I was in trouble. You have become my salvation.

22.verse: The stone that the builders rejected has become the very stone that holds together the entire foundation.

23.verse: This is the work of the Eternal, and it is marvelous in our eyes.

24.verse: This is the day the Eternal God has made; let us celebrate and be happy today.

25.verse: O Eternal One, save us, we beg You. O Eternal One, we beg You, bring us success!

26.verse: He who comes in the name of the Eternal will be blessed; we have blessed You from the house of the Eternal.

27.verse: The Eternal is the True God; He shines His light on us. Let the feast begin. Bring the sacrifice, and tie it to the horns of the altar.

28.verse: You are my God, and I give You thanks; You are my God, and I praise You.

29.verse: Give thanks to our Eternal Lord; He is always good. He never ceases to be loving and kind.

1.verse: Psalm 119 - Psalm 119 is the longest psalm in the collection. It is a hymn in praise of and appreciation for God’s instructions to His people. You see, God not only called Israel to be His people and gave them a wonderful land, but He gave them a blueprint for living. The Hebrew word for that is torah, sometimes translated “law” or “teachings.” In torah God tells them how to structure their lives and communities so that they will live long, prosperous lives in the land He has given them. As you read through the psalm, you will notice words like law, teachings, precepts, word, decrees, and commands. Each of these words is a synonym highlighting some attribute of God’s instructions to His people. Another memorable feature of this psalm is its form. The psalmist constructs this hymn as an elaborate acrostic poem that moves artfully through each letter of the Hebrew alphabet. Essentially, all the elements of this psalm combine to emphasize the importance of God’s Word to His people, to the praise and glory of the one True God. Aleph Happy are the people who walk with integrity, who live according to the teachings of the Eternal.

2.verse: Happy are the people who keep His decrees, who pursue Him wholeheartedly.

3.verse: These are people who do nothing wrong; they do what it takes to follow His ways.

4.verse: You have given us Your precepts so we would be careful about keeping them.

5.verse: Oh, that every part of my life would remain in line with what You require!

6.verse: Then I would feel no shame when I fix my eyes upon Your commands.

7.verse: With a pure heart, I will give thanks to You when I hear about Your just and fair rulings.

8.verse: I will live within Your limits; do not abandon me completely!

9.verse: Beth How can a young person remain pure? Only by living according to Your word.

10.verse: I have pursued You with my whole heart; do not let me stray from Your commands.

11.verse: Deep within me I have hidden Your word so that I will never sin against You.

12.verse: You are blessed, O Eternal One; instruct me in what You require.

13.verse: My lips have told how You have delivered all Your wise rulings.

14.verse: I have celebrated Your testimonies as though rejoicing over an immeasurable fortune.

15.verse: I will fix my mind on Your instructions and my eyes on Your path.

16.verse: I will find joy in Your ordinances; I will remember Your word forever.

17.verse: Gimel Treat Your servant well, Lord, so that I may live and remain faithful to Your word.

18.verse: Let me see clearly so that I may take in the amazing things coming from Your law.

19.verse: I am a sojourner in the world; do not keep Your commands hidden from me.

20.verse: My soul aches from craving Your wise rulings day and night.

21.verse: You rebuke those who are proud, and those who stray from Your commands are cursed.

22.verse: Free me from the contempt and disdain of others because I keep Your decrees.

23.verse: Even though powerful princes conspire against me, I fix my mind on what You require.

24.verse: Yes, Your testimonies are my joy; they are like the friends I seek for counsel.

25.verse: Daleth My very being clings to the dust; preserve my life, in keeping with Your word.

26.verse: I have admitted my ways are wrong, and You responded; now help me learn what You require.

27.verse: Compel me to grasp the way of Your statutes so I will fix my mind on Your wonderful works.

28.verse: My soul weeps, and trouble weighs me down; give me strength so I can stand according to Your word.

29.verse: Eliminate faithlessness You find in my step, be gracious, and give me Your guidance.

30.verse: I have decided to take the path of faith; I have focused my eyes on Your regulations.

31.verse: I cling to Your decrees; O Eternal One, do not let me face disgrace!

32.verse: I will chase after Your commandments because You will expand my understanding.

33.verse: He O Eternal One, show me how to live according to Your statutes, and I will keep them always.

34.verse: Grant me understanding so that I can keep Your law and keep it wholeheartedly.

35.verse: Guide me to walk in the way You commanded because I take joy in it.

36.verse: Turn my head and my heart to Your decrees and not to sinful gain.

37.verse: Keep my eyes from gazing upon worthless things, and give me true life according to Your plans.

38.verse: Verify Your word to Your servant, which will lead me to worship You.

39.verse: Take away the scorn that I dread because Your actions are just and good.

40.verse: Look and see—I long for Your guidance; restore me in Your righteousness.

41.verse: Vav May Your unfailing love find me, O Eternal One. Keep Your promise, and save me;

42.verse: When that happens, I will have a good response for anyone who taunts me because I have faith in Your word.

43.verse: Do not take Your message of truth from my mouth because I wait and rely on Your just decisions.

44.verse: Therefore I will follow Your teachings, forever and ever.

45.verse: And I will live a life of freedom because I pursue Your precepts.

46.verse: I will even testify of Your decrees before royalty and will not be humiliated.

47.verse: I will find my joy in Your commands, which I love,

48.verse: And I will raise my hands to Your commands, which I love, and I will fix my mind on what You require.

49.verse: Zayin Do not forget Your promise to Your servant; through it You have given me hope.

50.verse: This brings me solace in the midst of my troubles: that Your word has revived me.

51.verse: Those who are proud cruelly ridicule me, but I keep to the steady path of Your teachings.

52.verse: I have considered Your ancient rulings, O Eternal One, and their memory brings me comfort.

53.verse: Burning anger rises in me, has me in its grip because the unrighteous abandon Your teachings.

54.verse: As I journey through this life, Your statutes are my song.

55.verse: O Eternal One, through the night, I stop to recall Your name. That’s how I live according to Your teachings.

56.verse: This has become my practice: to keep Your ordinances.

57.verse: Heth The Eternal One is mine. He’s all I need. I have promised to keep Your words.

58.verse: I sought Your blessing wholeheartedly. Show grace to me as You promised.

59.verse: I carefully charted out my paths to align my steps with Your decrees.

60.verse: I did not procrastinate and hurried to follow Your commands.

61.verse: The wicked have entangled me in their nets, but I have not forgotten Your teaching.

62.verse: In the middle of the night, I wake to thank You because Your rulings are just and right.

63.verse: I am a friend of anyone who fears You and of those who follow Your precepts.

64.verse: The earth is filled with Your unfailing love, O Eternal One; teach me to observe what You require.

65.verse: Teth You have handled Your servant well, O Eternal One, as You promised.

66.verse: Help me to learn good judgment and knowledge because I believe Your commandments.

67.verse: Before I had trouble, I strayed from the true path, the path of righteousness, but now I live according to Your word.

68.verse: You are truly good, and Your acts are too; teach me what You require.

69.verse: The proud smear me with their lies; I will keep Your instructions wholeheartedly.

70.verse: Their hearts are dull and callous; I am delighted to study Your teaching.

71.verse: It is a good thing that I was humbled because it helped me learn Your limits.

72.verse: Your teachings are more valuable to me than a fortune in gold and silver.

73.verse: Yodh Your strong hands formed me and established me; give me understanding so I can learn Your commands.

74.verse: Let those who fear You see me and rejoice because I hope in Your word.

75.verse: I know, O Eternal One, Your rulings are right, and when You humbled me, You did so out of faithfulness.

76.verse: Now let Your unfailing love be my comfort, in keeping with Your promise to Your servant.

77.verse: Shower me with Your compassion so that I may live because I find great joy in Your law.

78.verse: Let the proud be humiliated, for they sabotage me with a lie; still I will fix my mind on Your directives.

79.verse: Let those who fear You and know Your testimonies come back and find me.

80.verse: Let my heart be whole, my record according to what You require so that I will not be humiliated.

81.verse: Kaph My soul is exhausted awaiting Your rescue yet I keep hoping in Your word.

82.verse: My eyes are strained as I look for what You promised, saying, “When will You come to comfort me?”

83.verse: Even though I have shriveled up like a wineskin left in the smoke, I still remember what You require.

84.verse: How long must Your servant wait? When will You carry out justice and punish those who persecute me?

85.verse: Those proud souls do not live according to Your commands, and they have dug pits to entrap me.

86.verse: Indeed, all Your commands are trustworthy, but my enemies have harassed me with their lies; help me!

87.verse: They have nearly ended my life on earth, but as for me, I never abandoned Your statutes.

88.verse: According to Your unfailing love, spare my life so that I can live according to the decrees of Your mouth.

89.verse: Lamedh Forever, O Eternal One, Your word stands in heaven, firm and resolute.

90.verse: Your faithfulness endures to every generation; You founded the earth, and it remains.

91.verse: Everything remains today in keeping with Your laws, for all things exist to serve You.

92.verse: If I had not found joy in Your guidance, then I would have died from my misery.

93.verse: I will never forget Your precepts, for through them You have given me life.

94.verse: I belong to You, Lord; save me because I have taken care to live by Your principles.

95.verse: The wicked lie in wait, anxious to kill me; I will set my mind on Your statutes.

96.verse: I have seen the limit of all perfection, but Your commands are all-encompassing.

97.verse: Mem Oh, how I love Your law! I fix my mind on it all day long.

98.verse: Your commands make me wiser than my enemies because they are always with me.

99.verse: I have more discernment than all my teachers because I study and meditate on Your testimonies.

100.verse: I comprehend more than those who are my elders because I have kept Your precepts.

101.verse: I have kept my feet from walking the paths of evil so that I may live according to Your word.

102.verse: I have not neglected Your lessons, for You, God, have been my teacher.

103.verse: Your words are sweet to my taste! Yes, they are sweeter than honey in my mouth!

104.verse: I gain understanding from Your instructions; that’s why I hate every deceitful path.

105.verse: Nun Your word is a lamp for my steps; it lights the path before me.

106.verse: I have taken an oath and confirmed it: I pledge to do what You say is right and just.

107.verse: I have suffered terribly, O Eternal One; give me the life You promised.

108.verse: Please accept the words I offer willingly, O Eternal One, and instruct me in the ways of Your justice.

109.verse: My soul is continually in danger, but I do not forget Your teachings.

110.verse: The wicked have laid a trap for me, but I have not drifted away from Your instructions.

111.verse: Your decrees are forever mine, for they bring joy to my life.

112.verse: I have committed myself to do what You require forever and ever, to the very end.

113.verse: Samekh I despise those who waver back and forth, but I love Your teachings.

114.verse: You are my hiding place and my shield of protection; I hope in Your word.

115.verse: Away from me, reprobates! I am committed to observing the commands of my God.

116.verse: Support me in keeping with Your promise, O God, so that I may live; do not let my hope turn into shame.

117.verse: Help me so that I will be safe, and I will respect Your laws continually.

118.verse: You have rejected all those who stray from Your commands because their fraudulent lifestyles are cunning and empty.

119.verse: You have discarded all the wicked from the land, skimmed them off like dross; that’s why I love Your testimonies.

120.verse: My body shakes because of my fear of You, and I am in awe of Your wise rulings.

121.verse: Ayin I have lived with fairness and integrity; do not leave me at the mercy of my tormenters.

122.verse: Provide security and protection for Your servant’s welfare; do not let the proud oppress me.

123.verse: My eyes are strained as I look for Your salvation and for Your righteous promise to be fulfilled.

124.verse: Treat Your servant in a manner that shows Your unfailing love, and help me to learn Your decrees.

125.verse: I am Your servant; impart to me understanding so that I may fully grasp the depths of Your statutes.

126.verse: It is time for the Eternal to step in and do something because some have broken Your law.

127.verse: Indeed, I love Your commands more than gold, even more than the highest quality gold.

128.verse: It’s true that I regard all Your guidance to be correct and good; I despise every deceptive path.

129.verse: Pe Your decrees inspire wonder; because of that, my soul desires to keep them.

130.verse: When Your words are unveiled, light shines forth; they bring understanding to the simple.

131.verse: My desire for Your commands left me waiting, open-mouthed and panting.

132.verse: Acknowledge me and show me Your grace as is Your habit toward all those who love Your name.

133.verse: Guide my steps in the ways of Your word, and do not let any sin control me.

134.verse: Rescue me from the torment of my human oppressors so that I may live according Your decrees.

135.verse: Let Your face shine upon Your servant, and help me to learn what You require.

136.verse: My eyes shed rivers of tears whenever people fail to keep Your teaching.

137.verse: Tsadhe You are good and just, O Eternal One, and Your rulings are right.

138.verse: You have set out Your decrees in justice, and they can be trusted.

139.verse: I am overwhelmed by my passion because my enemies have forgotten Your words.

140.verse: Your promise is tested and true; that’s why Your servant loves it.

141.verse: I may be insignificant to some and hated by others, but at least I do not forget Your precepts.

142.verse: Your righteousness will last forever, and Your law is truth.

143.verse: Trouble and distress have overtaken me, but Your commandments bring me great joy.

144.verse: Your decrees are right and true forever; grant me understanding so that I may live.

145.verse: Qoph I called to You wholeheartedly: “Answer me, O Eternal One!” I will respect, I will follow Your statutes.

146.verse: I cried out to You: “Rescue me, and I will live according to Your decrees.”

147.verse: I wake before the dawn and call for help; I hope in Your words.

148.verse: My eyes do not shut before each watch of the night so that I can fix my mind on Your word.

149.verse: Listen to my voice, in keeping with Your unfailing love. Preserve my life, O Eternal One, according to Your just rulings.

150.verse: Those who wish me harm are moving closer to me; they are far away from Your teaching.

151.verse: But You are near me, O Eternal One, and all You have commanded is true.

152.verse: I learned a long time ago that You established Your decrees to last forever.

153.verse: Resh Give attention to my misery and rescue me because I have not forgotten Your teaching.

154.verse: Fight for me, and set me free; give me life in keeping with Your promise.

155.verse: Salvation is far from the wicked because they do not live in pursuit of Your precepts.

156.verse: Your mercies are tender and great, O Eternal One; grant me life in keeping with Your ordinances.

157.verse: I have many oppressors and foes; still I do not swerve from Your decrees.

158.verse: I observe the faithless and detest them because they turn away from Your word.

159.verse: Reflect, O God, on how I love Your precepts; give me life, O Eternal One, in keeping with Your unfailing love.

160.verse: The entirety of Your word is truth, and every one of Your right rulings will surely last forever.

161.verse: Shin Princes persecute me without reason, but my heart remains true and is awed by Your words.

162.verse: I celebrate because of Your promise, like someone who discovers great treasure.

163.verse: I despise and abhor lies, but I love Your law.

164.verse: Seven times every day I praise You because of Your right rulings.

165.verse: Those who love Your law have an abundance of peace, and nothing along their paths can cause them to stumble.

166.verse: I wait for Your salvation, O Eternal One, and I live out Your commands.

167.verse: My soul is faithful to Your decrees, and my love for them is extraordinary.

168.verse: I live according to Your precepts and decrees because everything I do is right before Your eyes.

169.verse: Tav Let my cry come before You, O Eternal One. Grant me understanding in keeping with Your word.

170.verse: Let my plea come before You; liberate me in keeping with Your word.

171.verse: Praise will pour from my lips because You help me learn what You require.

172.verse: My tongue will sing of Your word because every command of Yours is right.

173.verse: Let Your hand be poised to help me because I have chosen to live by Your precepts.

174.verse: I long for Your salvation, O Eternal One. Meanwhile, Your teaching brings me great joy.

175.verse: Let my soul live on so that I may praise You, and let Your precepts guide me.

176.verse: I have wandered down the wrong path like a lost sheep; come find me, Your servant, because I do not forget Your commands.

1.verse: Psalm 120 - A song for those journeying to worship. The Songs for the Journey to Worship (Psalms 120–134) celebrate the journey to Jerusalem to worship in God’s temple. Centuries before these psalms were composed, the Lord chose to make His earthly home on Mount Zion in Jerusalem and directed David’s son to build His house. King Solomon built the first temple and dedicated it to God in an elaborate ceremony that brought Israel together on the holy mountain (1 Kings 8). Now, clearly, the wise king believed that the one True God was present everywhere in the world, but he knew that Jerusalem was a special place, a sacred space picked by God. Solomon understood what we seem to have forgotten: those created in God’s image long to encounter God in His holiness. And if we try to make every place holy, then no place is holy because holy means “set apart,” “distinct,” “special.” So we need sacredness in our lives: sacred times, places, and people in our search for wholeness, for shalom. For centuries God’s faithful people of the first and second covenants have gone on pilgrimages to the Holy Land and Jerusalem. Often these songs have gone with them, for they desire to draw close to God and to walk in the steps of those who have passed the faith along. When I was in deep trouble, I called out to the Eternal, and He answered my call.

2.verse: I prayed: “Protect me, Eternal, from lips that lie and tongues poisoned with deceit.”

3.verse: Liars, what will be your prize? And what will come your way, O you tongues poisoned with deceit?

4.verse: Here’s what you can expect: the archers’ arrows honed sharp as well as the red-hot coals of the broom wood.

5.verse: Sorrow is mine, for I am a foreigner wandering in Meshech; I am a stranger drifting among the tents of Kedar!

6.verse: My soul has roamed much too long among people who despise peace.

7.verse: I am for peace; I ask for peace, but even as I open my mouth, they are ready to fight.

1.verse: Psalm 121 - A song for those journeying to worship. I look up at the vast size of the mountains— from where will my help come in times of trouble?

2.verse: The Eternal Creator of heaven and earth and these mountains will send the help I need.

3.verse: He holds you firmly in place; He will not let you fall. He who keeps you will never take His eyes off you and never drift off to sleep.

4.verse: What a relief! The One who watches over Israel never leaves for rest or sleep.

5.verse: The Eternal keeps you safe, so close to Him that His shadow is a cooling shade to you.

6.verse: Neither bright light of sun nor dim light of moon will harm you.

7.verse: The Eternal will keep you safe from all of life’s evils,

8.verse: From your first breath to the last breath you breathe, from this day and forever.

1.verse: Psalm 122 - A song [of David] for those journeying to worship. This is a Davidic psalm celebrating the grandeur and significance of Jerusalem and its temple. It is ironic that Jerusalem means “city of peace” since more battles have been fought over it than over any other city. I was so happy when my fellow pilgrims said, “Let’s go to the house of the Eternal!”

2.verse: We have made the journey, and now we are standing within your gates, O Jerusalem.

3.verse: Jerusalem! What a magnificent city! Buildings so close together, so compact.

4.verse: God’s people belong here. Every tribe of the Eternal makes its way to Jerusalem— Just as God decreed for Israel to come together and give thanks to the Eternal.

5.verse: In Jerusalem, justice is the order of the day because there sit the judges and kings, the descendants of David.

6.verse: Ask heaven to grant peace to Jerusalem: “May those who love you prosper.

7.verse: O Jerusalem, may His peace fill this entire city! May this citadel be quiet and at ease!”

8.verse: It’s because of people—my family, friends, and acquaintances— that I say, “May peace permeate you.”

9.verse: And because the house of Eternal One, our God, is here, know this: I will always seek your good!

1.verse: Psalm 123 - A song for those journeying to worship. I raise my eyes to fix my gaze on You, for Your throne resides in the heavens.

2.verse: Just as the eyes of servants closely watch the hand of their masters, Just as a maid carefully observes the slightest gesture of her mistress, In the same way we look to You, Eternal One, waiting for our God to pour out His mercy upon us.

3.verse: O Eternal One, show us Your mercy. We beg You. We are not strangers to contempt and pain.

4.verse: We have suffered more than our share of ridicule and contempt from self-appointed critics who live easy lives and pompously display their own importance.

1.verse: Psalm 124 - A song of David for those journeying to worship. If the Eternal had not been with us— sing, Israel, sing—

2.verse: If He had not been with us when the villains came for us,

3.verse: When their anger flamed around us, they would have swallowed us up alive!

4.verse: Their hatred was like a flood: the waters were rising and would have engulfed us; the streams were rushing past and would have overcome us.

5.verse: The furious waters would have broken over us. Battered and overwhelmed, we surely would have drowned!

6.verse: Blessed be the Eternal who did not leave us to be torn by their fangs!

7.verse: Our souls cry out: “We escaped with our lives like a bird from the fowler’s snare! The snare was broken, and we escaped with our lives!”

8.verse: Our help has come in the name of the Eternal, the Maker of heaven and earth!

1.verse: Psalm 125 - A song for those journeying to worship. All who have faith in the Eternal stand as Mount Zion: unmoved, enduring, eternal.

2.verse: Just as the mountains around Jerusalem embrace her, the Eternal, too, wraps around those who belong to Him— for this moment and for every moment to come.

3.verse: For wickedness will not get the upper hand; it shall not rule the land where righteous people live Lest good people go bad and do what is wrong.

4.verse: Be good, Eternal One, to those who are good, to those who are filled with integrity.

5.verse: The Eternal will send all the wicked away along with those who pervert what’s good and twist it in their own crooked way. May peace be with Israel.

1.verse: Psalm 126 - A song for those journeying to worship. Remember when the Eternal brought back the exiles to Zion? It was as if we were dreaming—

2.verse: Our mouths were filled with laughter; our tongues were spilling over into song. The word went out across the prairies and deserts, across the hills, over the oceans wide, from nation to nation: “The Eternal has done remarkable things for them.”

3.verse: We shook our heads. All of us were stunned—the Eternal has done remarkable things for us. We were beyond happy, beyond joyful.

4.verse: And now, Eternal One, some are held captive and poor. Release them, and restore our fortunes as the dry riverbeds of the South spring to life when the rains come at last.

5.verse: Those who walk the fields to sow, casting their seed in tears, will one day tread those same long rows, amazed by what’s appeared.

6.verse: Those who weep as they walk and plant with sighs Will return singing with joy, when they bring home the harvest.

1.verse: Psalm 127 - A song of Solomon for those journeying to worship. Psalm 127 is attributed to Solomon, underscoring the futility of human endeavor apart from God. It is similar in tone and theme to other wisdom literature. Unless the Eternal builds the house, those who labor to raise it will have worked for nothing. Unless the Eternal stands watch over the city, those who guard it have wasted their time.

2.verse: God provides for His own. It is pointless to get up early, work hard, and go to bed late Anxiously laboring for food to eat; for God provides for those He loves, even while they are sleeping.

3.verse: Know this: children are a gift from the Eternal; the fruit of the womb is His reward.

4.verse: Your sons born in your youth are a protection, like arrows in the hand of a warrior.

5.verse: Happy is the man who has his quiver full, for they will help and protect him when he is old. He will not be humiliated when he is accused at the gate, for his sons will stand with him against his enemies.

1.verse: Psalm 128 - A song for those journeying to worship. Those who stand in awe of the Eternal— who follow wherever He leads, committed in their hearts—experience His blessings!

2.verse: God will use your hard work to provide you food. You will prosper in your labor, and it will go well for you.

3.verse: Your wife will be like a healthy vine producing plenty of fruit, a spring of life in your home. Your children will be like young olive shoots; you will watch them bud and bloom around your table.

4.verse: Such are the blessings the Eternal lavishes on those who stand in awe of Him!

5.verse: May the Eternal continue to pour out His love on you, showering down blessings from His holy mountain, Zion. May you see Jerusalem prosper all your days.

6.verse: May you have the privilege of seeing your grandchildren as they grow. May peace flourish in Israel!

1.verse: Psalm 129 - A song for those journeying to worship. “This is not the first time my enemies assaulted me; they have often attacked me since I was young.” So let Israel now proclaim,

2.verse: “This is not the first time my enemies assaulted me; they have attacked me since I was young, and yet they have not been able to overpower me.

3.verse: The plowers plowed over me; they plowed their furrows deep and long down my back.”

4.verse: The Eternal is just. He’s severed the bindings of the wicked so they can’t hurt me anymore.

5.verse: May all who despise Zion hang their heads in shame. May all who despise Zion recoil and run away.

6.verse: Let them grow like grass upon rooftops that withers and dies in the sun long before it has time to grow,

7.verse: Unfit to be harvested by the worker, not worthy of the effort to carry off to the binder.

8.verse: Unwanted, uncared for—no passersby to greet them, no one to say, “May the favor of the Eternal be upon you; We bless you in His name.”

1.verse: Psalm 130 - A song for those journeying to worship. From the depths of disaster I appeal to You, O Eternal One:

2.verse: Lord, hear my cry! Attune Your ears to my humble prayer!

3.verse: If You, Eternal One, recorded each offense, Lord, who on earth could stand innocent?

4.verse: But with You forgiveness exists; that’s why true respect of You might flow.

5.verse: So I wait for the Eternal—my soul awaits rescue— and I put my hope in His transforming word.

6.verse: My soul waits for the Lord to break into the world more than night watchmen expect the break of day, even more than night watchmen expect the break of day.

7.verse: O Israel, ground your hope in the Eternal. For in the Eternal lives the most loyal love, and with Him comes the most abundant redemption.

8.verse: He will ransom Israel from all the sinful acts that stole you away.

1.verse: Psalm 131 - A song of David for those journeying to worship. O Eternal One, my heart is not occupied with proud thoughts; my eyes do not look down on others; I don’t even begin to get involved in matters too big, matters of faith, state, business, or the many things that defy my ability to understand them.

2.verse: Of one thing I am certain: my soul has become calm, quiet, and contented in You. Like a weaned child resting upon his mother, I am quiet. My soul is like this weaned child.

3.verse: O Israel, stake your trust completely in the Eternal— from this very moment and into the vast future.

1.verse: Psalm 132 - A song for those journeying to worship. Eternal One, don’t let the suffering of our father David be forgotten— for his sake, remember!

2.verse: Remember the pledge he made, how he poured out his heart to the Eternal, the promise he made to the Mighty One of Jacob:

3.verse: He said, “I will not go inside my house or lie down in my bed;

4.verse: I will not even rest my eyes— I will not take comfort in sleep—

5.verse: Until I find a dwelling place for You, the Eternal, a holy residence dedicated to the Mighty One of Jacob.”

6.verse: We heard rumors of the holy ark in Ephrathah, and later we found it in the field of Jaar.

7.verse: Let us journey to His dwelling place; let us worship at His footstool.

8.verse: Eternal One, arise and go to Your new home— You and the ark of Your strength.

9.verse: Let every priest join the march wearing righteousness, and let songs of joy erupt from the hearts and mouths of Your godly ones.

10.verse: For the well-being of Your anointed servant, do not turn Your back on David.

11.verse: The Eternal made His own promise, sworn in truth to David, an oath which He cannot, will not break: “I will continue your dynasty, David; one of your descendants will sit on your throne.

12.verse: If your children obey My covenant and follow the statutes which I shall teach them, And if they remain faithful, their children will also sit upon your throne—forever.”

13.verse: For the Eternal selected Zion; He desired it as His holy place of residence.

14.verse: “This is My sanctuary, My resting place, forever and ever; I will remain here, for this is what I have desired.

15.verse: I will bless Zion with an endless supply of all she needs; I will satisfy the bellies of her hungry with bread.

16.verse: I will clothe her priests with salvation, and songs of joy will erupt from the hearts and mouths of her godly people.

17.verse: “From there I will make the strength of David’s kingdom grow and prepare a lamp for My anointed one.

18.verse: I will clothe his enemies with a garment of shame; but as for David’s son, his crown will shine brightly like the sun.”

1.verse: Psalm 133 - A song of David for those journeying to worship. How good and pleasant it is when brothers and sisters live together in peace!

2.verse: It is like the finest oils poured on the head, sweet-smelling oils flowing down to cover the beard, Flowing down the beard of Aaron, flowing down the collar of his robe.

3.verse: It is like the gentle rain of Mount Hermon that falls on the hills of Zion. Yes, from this place, the Eternal spoke the command, from there He gave His blessing—life forever.

1.verse: Psalm 134 - A song for those journeying to worship. Praise the Eternal, all you who serve Him— who stand ready to serve in the house of the Eternal through the night.

2.verse: Lift up your hands toward His sanctuary, and praise the Eternal.

3.verse: May the Eternal grant you His blessing from Zion, God, the weaver of heaven and earth.

1.verse: Psalm 135 - Praise the Eternal! Praise and glorify the name of the One who always has been and always will be; praise Him, servants of the Eternal!

2.verse: Join in the chorus, all you who minister in the Eternal’s temple; in the courts of our God’s temple,

3.verse: Glorify the Eternal, for He is good! Sing praises, and honor His name for it is delightful.

4.verse: For the Eternal made His choice; He selected Jacob as His own; He claimed Israel as His possession.

5.verse: Now I know this: the Eternal is great; His power is unmatched. Our Master is above any so-called god.

6.verse: He does whatever He pleases, in heaven, on earth, in the seas, and in all the ocean depths.

7.verse: He draws up the clouds that rise over the whole earth, He causes rain and the lightning to strike, and He summons the wind from His storehouses.

8.verse: He took the lives of Egypt’s firstborn, human and beast alike.

9.verse: O Egypt, He worked wonders and signs before your eyes, signs against Pharaoh and Pharaoh’s servants.

10.verse: He destroyed nation after nation and killed mighty kings:

11.verse: Sihon, the Amorite king; Og, the king of Bashan; and even all the kingdoms of Canaan.

12.verse: He conquered their land and gave it as an inheritance— an inheritance for His people, Israel.

13.verse: Eternal One, Your name is everlasting. Your legacy, Eternal One, will be known through all the ages.

14.verse: For the Eternal will judge His people, He will show compassion to those who serve Him.

15.verse: The nations have idols of silver and gold, crafted by human hands!

16.verse: They shaped mouths for them, but they cannot speak; they carved eyes into them, but they cannot see;

17.verse: They placed ears on them, but they cannot hear; they cannot breathe, not even a puff of air from their mouths!

18.verse: The artisans who made them are just like them, and so are all who mistakenly trust in them, no exceptions.

19.verse: House of Israel, praise the Eternal; house of Aaron, praise the Eternal;

20.verse: House of Levi, praise the Eternal; all those who revere the Eternal, praise Him!

21.verse: Blessed be the Eternal from Zion, the One who has made Jerusalem His home. Praise the Eternal!

1.verse: Psalm 136 - This hymn of praise recounts God’s actions in the past: creation, exodus, and the giving of the land to Israel. A repeated refrain indicates this psalm was chanted responsively. Let your heart overflow with praise to the Eternal, for He is good, for His faithful love lasts forever.

2.verse: Praise the True God who reigns over all other gods, for His faithful love lasts forever.

3.verse: Praise the Lord who reigns over all other lords, for His faithful love lasts forever.

4.verse: To Him who alone does marvelous wonders, for His faithful love lasts forever.

5.verse: Who created the heavens with skill and artistry, for His faithful love lasts forever.

6.verse: Who laid out dry land over the waters, for His faithful love lasts forever.

7.verse: Who made the great heavenly lights, for His faithful love lasts forever.

8.verse: The sun to reign by day, for His faithful love lasts forever.

9.verse: The moon and stars to reign by night, for His faithful love lasts forever.

10.verse: To Him who struck down the firstborn of the Egyptians, for His faithful love lasts forever.

11.verse: Who set Israel free from Egyptian masters, for His faithful love lasts forever.

12.verse: With fierce strength, a mighty hand, and an outstretched arm, for His faithful love lasts forever.

13.verse: To Him who split the Red Sea in two and made a path between the divided waters, for His faithful love lasts forever.

14.verse: Then allowed Israel to pass safely through on dry ground, for His faithful love lasts forever.

15.verse: To Him who crushed Pharaoh and his army in the waters of the Red Sea, for His faithful love lasts forever.

16.verse: Who guided His people through the desert, for His faithful love lasts forever.

17.verse: Who struck down mighty kings, for His faithful love lasts forever.

18.verse: Who slaughtered famous kings, for His faithful love lasts forever.

19.verse: Sihon, the king of the Amorites, for His faithful love lasts forever.

20.verse: And Og, the king of Bashan, for His faithful love lasts forever.

21.verse: To Him who gave the conquered land as an inheritance, for His faithful love lasts forever.

22.verse: Who made the land a heritage to Israel, His servant, for His faithful love lasts forever.

23.verse: To Him who remembered us when we were nearly defeated, for His faithful love lasts forever.

24.verse: Who rescued us from our enemies, for His faithful love lasts forever.

25.verse: Who provides food for every living thing, for His faithful love lasts forever.

26.verse: Let your heart overflow with praise to the True God of heaven, for His faithful love lasts forever.

1.verse: Psalm 137 - Psalm 137 is a lament written either during or shortly after the exile. It provides a vivid image of what life in exile must have been like. By the rivers of Babylon, we sat and wept when we thought of Zion, our home, so far away.

2.verse: On the branches of the willow trees, we hung our harps and hid our hearts from the enemy.

3.verse: And the men that surrounded us made demands that we clap our hands and sing— Songs of joy from days gone by, songs from Zion, our home. Such cruel men taunted us—haunted our memories.

4.verse: How could we sing a song about the Eternal in a land so foreign, while still tormented, brokenhearted, homesick? Please don’t make us sing this song.

5.verse: O Jerusalem, even still, don’t escape my memory. I treasure you and your songs, even as I hide my harp from the enemy. And if I can’t remember, may I never sing a song again— may my hands never play well again— For what use would it be if I don’t remember Jerusalem as my source of joy?

6.verse: O Jerusalem, even still, don’t escape my memory. I treasure you and your songs, even as I hide my harp from the enemy. And if I can’t remember, may I never sing a song again— may my hands never play well again— For what use would it be if I don’t remember Jerusalem as my source of joy?

7.verse: Remember, Eternal One, how the Edomites, our brothers, the descendants of Esau, stood by and watched as Jerusalem fell. Gloating, they said, “Destroy it; tear it down to the ground,” when Jerusalem was being demolished.

8.verse: O daughter of Babylon, you are destined for destruction! Happy are those who pay you back for how you treated us so you will no longer walk so proud.

9.verse: Happy are those who dash your children against the rocks so you will know how it feels.

1.verse: Psalm 138 - A song of David. To You, Lord, I give my whole heart, a heart filled with praise, for I am grateful; before the gods, my heart sings praises to You and You alone.

2.verse: I bow before You, looking to Your holy temple, and praise Your name, for Your unfailing love and Your truth; for You have placed Your name and Your word over all things and all times.

3.verse: On the day I needed You, I called, and You responded and infused my soul with strength.

4.verse: May all the kings of the earth praise You, O Eternal One, because they have heard the words You have spoken.

5.verse: They will marvel at the Eternal’s ways, and they will sing, for great is the glory of the Eternal.

6.verse: Although He is greatest of all, He is attentive to the needy and keeps His distance from the proud and pompous.

7.verse: Whenever I walk into trouble, You are there to bring me out. You hold out Your hand to protect me against the wrath of my enemies, and hold me safely in Your right hand.

8.verse: The Eternal will finish what He started in me. Your faithful love, O Eternal One, lasts forever; do not give up on what Your hands have made.

1.verse: Psalm 139 - For the worship leader. A song of David. O Eternal One, You have explored my heart and know exactly who I am;

2.verse: You even know the small details like when I take a seat and when I stand up again. Even when I am far away, You know what I’m thinking.

3.verse: You observe my wanderings and my sleeping, my waking and my dreaming, and You know everything I do in more detail than even I know.

4.verse: You know what I’m going to say long before I say it. It is true, Eternal One, that You know everything and everyone.

5.verse: You have surrounded me on every side, behind me and before me, and You have placed Your hand gently on my shoulder.

6.verse: It is the most amazing feeling to know how deeply You know me, inside and out; the realization of it is so great that I cannot comprehend it.

7.verse: Can I go anywhere apart from Your Spirit? Is there anywhere I can go to escape Your watchful presence?

8.verse: If I go up into heaven, You are there. If I make my bed in the realm of the dead, You are there.

9.verse: If I ride on the wings of morning, if I make my home in the most isolated part of the ocean,

10.verse: Even then You will be there to guide me; Your right hand will embrace me, for You are always there.

11.verse: Even if I am afraid and think to myself, “There is no doubt that the darkness will swallow me, the light around me will soon be turned to night,”

12.verse: You can see in the dark, for it is not dark to Your eyes. For You the night is just as bright as the day. Darkness and light are the same to Your eyes.

13.verse: For You shaped me, inside and out. You knitted me together in my mother’s womb long before I took my first breath.

14.verse: I will offer You my grateful heart, for I am Your unique creation, filled with wonder and awe. You have approached even the smallest details with excellence; Your works are wonderful; I carry this knowledge deep within my soul.

15.verse: You see all things; nothing about me was hidden from You As I took shape in secret, carefully crafted in the heart of the earth before I was born from its womb.

16.verse: You see all things; You saw me growing, changing in my mother’s womb; Every detail of my life was already written in Your book; You established the length of my life before I ever tasted the sweetness of it.

17.verse: Your thoughts and plans are treasures to me, O God! I cherish each and every one of them! How grand in scope! How many in number!

18.verse: If I could count each one of them, they would be more than all the grains of sand on earth. Their number is inconceivable! Even when I wake up, I am still near to You.

19.verse: I wish You would destroy all the wicked, O God. So keep away from me, those who are thirsty for blood!

20.verse: For they say such horrible things about You, and those who are against You abuse Your good name.

21.verse: Is it not true that I hate all who hate You, Eternal One? Is it not true that I despise all who come against You?

22.verse: Deep hatred boils within me toward them; I am Your friend, and they are my enemies.

23.verse: Explore me, O God, and know the real me. Dig deeply and discover who I am. Put me to the test and watch how I handle the strain.

24.verse: Examine me to see if there is an evil bone in me, and guide me down Your path forever.

1.verse: Psalm 140 - For the worship leader. A song of David. Save me, O Eternal One, from the evil men who seek my life. Shield me from this band of violent men.

2.verse: Their hearts devise evil! They conspire against me; they are constantly causing a storm of war.

3.verse: These snakes have sharpened their tongues; viper venom hides beneath their lips. [pause]

4.verse: Keep me from the grip of these cruel men, O Eternal One. Shield me from this band of violent men whose only intention is to trip me up and undermine all I do.

5.verse: Those arrogant people are trying to catch me; they’ve laid their trap, hiding a net along my path; their traps are set, and I am the prey. [pause]

6.verse: “Eternal One,” I said, “You are my one and only God. Hear me, O Eternal, hear my humble cry for rescue.

7.verse: O Lord, Eternal One, power of my deliverance, You are my helmet in the day of battle.

8.verse: So do not fulfill the desires of these evildoers, Eternal One; do not advance their evil schemes, lest they brag about their successes. [pause]

9.verse: “As for the gang leader of those who surround me, let their mischievous words cover them; smother them in trouble.

10.verse: Let hot coals fall from heaven upon them and cast them into the roaring fires. May they sink into the muddy marsh from which there is no return.

11.verse: Let no liar find a home anywhere in the land; let evil hunt down the violent man and do him in quickly.”

12.verse: I am certain the Eternal supports the cause of the distressed; the poor will receive the justice they deserve.

13.verse: Indeed, the just-living will glorify Your name, and honorable people will be at home in Your presence.

1.verse: Psalm 141 - A song of David. O Eternal One, I call upon You. Come quickly! Listen to my voice as I call upon You!

2.verse: Consider my prayer as an offering of incense that rises before You; when I stand with my hands outstretched pleading toward the heavens, consider it as an evening offering.

3.verse: Guard my mouth, O Eternal One; control what I say. Keep a careful watch on every word I speak.

4.verse: Don’t allow my deepest desires to steer me toward doing what is wrong or associating with wicked people Or joining in their wicked works or tasting any of their pleasures.

5.verse: Let those who do right strike me down in kindness and correct me in love. Their kind correction washes over my head like pure oil; do not let me be foolish and refuse such compassion. Still my prayer is against the deeds of the wicked:

6.verse: Their judges will be thrown from the edges of cliffs and crushed upon the rocks below, and the wicked will hear my words and realize that what I said was pleasing.

7.verse: Just as when a farmer plows and breaks open the earth, leaving clumps of dirt scattered along the rows, our bones are scattered at the mouth of the grave.

8.verse: My gaze is fixed upon You, Eternal One, my Lord; in You I find safety and protection. Do not abandon me and leave me defenseless.

9.verse: Protect me from the jaws of the trap my enemies have set for me and from the snares of those who work evil.

10.verse: May the wicked be caught in their own nets while I alone escape unharmed.

1.verse: Psalm 142 - A contemplative prayer of David while he hid in a cave. I call out loudly to the Eternal One; I lift my voice to the Eternal begging for His favor.

2.verse: I let everything that’s going wrong spill out of my mouth; I spell out all my troubles to Him.

3.verse: When my spirit buckled under the burdens I bear, You knew my way. They conspired to trip me up and trap me on the path where I was walking.

4.verse: Take a look around and see—to the right, to the left— no one is there who cares for me. There’s no way out of here; no one cares about the state of my soul.

5.verse: You are the One I called to, O Eternal One. I said, “You’re the only safe place I know; You’re all I’ve got in this world.

6.verse: Oh, let me know that You hear my cry because I’m languishing and desperate; Rescue me from those who torment me because there’s no way I can stand up to them; they are much too strong for me.

7.verse: Lift my captive soul from this dark prison so I may render to You my gratitude; Then Your righteous people will gather around me because You will treat me with astounding goodness.”

1.verse: Psalm 143 - A song of David. Eternal One, I come to You in prayer. Hear me out; I plead with You. Lend an ear to my requests. In Your faithfulness and justice, respond to my pleas.

2.verse: Be kind and slow to judge Your faithful servant, for compared to You, no one is truly just.

3.verse: My adversary has pressed in, drawn closer, threatened my life; he’s crushed me, driven me underground. He’s forced me to live in the dark; it’s as if I joined those who died a long time ago.

4.verse: That’s why my spirit is growing faint inside me; I have nothing left; my heart is completely empty and desolate.

5.verse: And yet I can’t forget the days of old, the days I’ve heard so much about; I fix my mind on all You have done; I ponder the work of Your hands;

6.verse: I reach out my hands to You. All that I am aches and yearns for You, like a dry land thirsting for rain. [pause]

7.verse: Hurry and answer me, O Eternal One, for my spirit is weak, my courage is gone. Do not turn away; let me see Your face; otherwise, I’ll die and be like all those who have gone to the grave.

8.verse: Make me hear of Your faithful love in the morning, for I trust in You. Teach me how I should walk, for I offer my soul up to You.

9.verse: Rescue me from my enemies, Eternal One, for You are my shelter from them.

10.verse: Teach me how to do Your will, for You are my God. Allow Your good Spirit to guide me on level ground, to guide me along Your path.

11.verse: For the sake of Your name and the good of Your reputation, preserve me, O Eternal One. In Your righteousness, save my life from burden and misery.
