12.verse: In Your loyal love, silence my enemies for good; destroy all those who take pleasure in my suffering, for I am Your faithful servant!

1.verse: Psalm 144 - A song of David. Blessed be the Eternal, my rock. He trains my hands for war, gives me the skills I need for battle.

2.verse: He is my unfailing love and my citadel. He is my tower of strength and my deliverer. He is my shield of protection and my shelter; He holds my people in check under me.

3.verse: O Eternal One, what is man, that You even care to know him? or the son of man, that You are mindful of him?

4.verse: Humans are like a passing breath; their time on earth is like a shadow that passes over us during the day and soon is gone.

5.verse: Eternal One, stretch out an opening in the heavens, and descend. Touch the mountains, and make them smoke.

6.verse: Send forth bolts of lightning, and scatter my enemies. Shoot Your fiery arrows, and rout the enemy.

7.verse: Reach down from Your high place; save me out of the great waters; rescue me from the grasp of these foreigners

8.verse: Who speak only lies and don’t have truth in their deeds.

9.verse: To You, my God, I will sing a new song; I will sing Your sweet praises to the sound of a ten-stringed harp,

10.verse: For You deliver kings from their enemies and You rescue Your servant, David, from the sword of evil.

11.verse: Rescue me, and save me from the grasp of these foreigners Who speak only lies and don’t have truth in their deeds.

12.verse: May our sons be like healthy plants as they grow and mature, And may our daughters be like the corner pillars that decorate a palace.

13.verse: May our storehouses be full with abundant supplies of every crop, And may the flocks of our fields multiply into thousands and tens of thousands!

14.verse: May our cattle be strong and productive, without miscarriage, without loss, and may there be no riots or protests in our streets!

15.verse: Happy are the people for whom all this is true; happy are the people whose God is the Eternal!

1.verse: Psalm 145 - A song of praise by David. I will lift my praise above everything to You, my God and King! I will continually bless Your name forever and always.

2.verse: My praise will never cease— I will praise You every day; I will lift up Your name forever.

3.verse: The Eternal is great and deserves endless praise; His greatness knows no limit, recognizes no boundary. No one can measure or comprehend His magnificence.

4.verse: One generation after another will celebrate Your great works; they will pass on the story of Your powerful acts to their children.

5.verse: Your majesty and glorious splendor have captivated me; I will meditate on Your wonders, sing songs of Your worth.

6.verse: We confess—there is nothing greater than You, God, nothing mightier than Your awesome works. I will tell of Your greatness as long as I have breath.

7.verse: The news of Your rich goodness is no secret— Your people love to recall it and sing songs of joy to celebrate Your righteousness.

8.verse: The Eternal is gracious. He shows mercy to His people. For Him anger does not come easily, but faithful love does—and it is rich and abundant.

9.verse: But the Eternal’s goodness is not exclusive—it is offered freely to all. His mercy extends to all His creation.

10.verse: All creation will stand in awe of You, O Eternal One. Thanks will pour from the mouths of every one of Your creatures; Your holy people will bless You.

11.verse: They will not be silent; they will talk of the grandeur of Your kingdom and celebrate the wonder of Your power

12.verse: Until everyone on earth who has ears to hear knows Your valiant acts and the splendor of Your kingdom.

13.verse: Your kingdom will never end; Your rule will endure forever. [You are faithful to Your promise, and Your acts are marked with grace.]

14.verse: The Eternal sustains all who stumble on their way. For those who are broken down, God is near. He raises them up in hope.

15.verse: All eyes have turned toward You, waiting in expectation; when they are hungry, You feed them right on time.

16.verse: The desires of every living thing are met by Your open hand.

17.verse: The Eternal is right in all His ways, and He is kind in all His acts.

18.verse: The Eternal stays close to those who call on Him, those who pray sincerely.

19.verse: All of you who revere Him— God will satisfy your desires. He hears the cries for help, and He brings salvation.

20.verse: All of you who love God— He will watch out for you, but total destruction is around the corner for all the wicked.

21.verse: My lips will sing the praise of the Eternal. Let every creature join me and praise the holy name of God—forever and always!

1.verse: Psalm 146 - Praise the Eternal! Praise the Eternal, O my soul;

2.verse: I will praise the Eternal for as long as I live. I will sing praises to my God as long as breath fills my lungs and blood flows through my veins.

3.verse: Do not put your trust in the rulers of this world—kings and princes. Do not expect any rescue from mortal men.

4.verse: As soon as their breath leaves them, they return to the earth; on that day, all of them perish—their dreams, their plans, and their memories.

5.verse: Blessed are those whose help comes from the God of Jacob, whose hope is centered in the Eternal their God—

6.verse: Who created the heavens, the earth, the seas, and all that lives within them; Who stays true and remains faithful forever;

7.verse: Who works justice for those who are pressed down by the world, providing food for those who are hungry. The Eternal frees those who are imprisoned;

8.verse: He makes the blind see. He lifts up those whose backs are bent in labor; He cherishes those who do what is right.

9.verse: The Eternal looks after those who journey in a land not their own; He takes care of the orphan and the widow, but He frustrates the wicked along their way.

10.verse: The Eternal will reign today, tomorrow, and forever. People of Zion, your God will rule forever over all generations. Praise the Eternal!

1.verse: Psalm 147 - Praise the Eternal! It is good to sing praises to our God, for praise is beautiful and pleasant.

2.verse: The Eternal, Architect of earth, is building Jerusalem, finding the lost, gathering Israel’s outcasts.

3.verse: He binds their wounds, heals the sorrows of their hearts.

4.verse: He counts all the stars within His hands, carefully fixing their number and giving them names.

5.verse: Our Lord is great. Nothing is impossible with His overwhelming power. He is loving, compassionate, and wise beyond all measure.

6.verse: The Eternal will lift up the lowly but throw down the wicked to the earth.

7.verse: Psalm 147 is a postexilic hymn of praise to God as Creator and Sustainer. It celebrates the rebuilding of the walls and gates that protect Jerusalem. God secures the city, grants peace to the border towns, and controls the elements. Open your mouths with thanks! Sing praises to the Eternal! Strum the harp in unending praise to our God

8.verse: Who blankets the heavens with clouds, sends rain to water the thirsty earth, and pulls up each blade of grass upon the mountainside.

9.verse: He opens His hands to feed all the animals and scatters seed to nestlings when they cry.

10.verse: He takes no pleasure in the raw strength of horses; He finds no joy in the speed of the sprinter.

11.verse: But the Eternal does take pleasure in those who worship Him, those who invest hope in His unfailing love.

12.verse: O Jerusalem, praise the Eternal! O Zion, praise your God!

13.verse: For His divine power reinforces your city gates, blesses your children in the womb.

14.verse: He establishes peace within your borders, fills your markets with hearty golden wheat.

15.verse: His command ripples across the earth; His word runs out on swift feet.

16.verse: He blankets the earth in wooly snow, scattering frost like ashes over the land.

17.verse: He throws down hail like stones falling from a mountain. Can any withstand His wintry blast?

18.verse: But He dispatches His word, and the thaw begins; at His command, the spring winds blow, gently stirring the waters back to life.

19.verse: He brings Jacob in on His plan, declaring His word— His statutes and His teachings to Israel.

20.verse: He has not treated any other nation in such a way; they live unaware of His commands. Praise the Eternal!

1.verse: Psalm 148 - Praise the Eternal! All you in the heavens, praise the Eternal; praise Him from the highest places!

2.verse: All you, His messengers and His armies in heaven: praise Him!

3.verse: Sun, moon, and all you brilliant stars above: praise Him!

4.verse: Highest heavens and all you waters above the heavens: praise Him!

5.verse: Let all things join together in a concert of praise to the name of the Eternal, for He gave the command and they were created.

6.verse: He put them in their places to stay forever— He declared it so, and it is final.

7.verse: Everything on earth, join in and praise the Eternal; sea monsters and creatures of the deep,

8.verse: Lightning and hail, snow and foggy mists, violent winds all respond to His command.

9.verse: Mountains and hills, fruit trees and cedar forests,

10.verse: All you animals both wild and tame, reptiles and birds who take flight: praise the Lord.

11.verse: All kings and all nations, princes and all judges of the earth,

12.verse: All people, young men and women, old men and children alike, praise the Lord.

13.verse: Let them all praise the name of the Eternal! For His name stands alone above all others. His glory shines greater than anything above or below.

14.verse: He has made His people strong; He is the praise of all who are godly, the praise of the children of Israel, those whom He holds close. Praise the Eternal!

1.verse: Psalm 149 - Praise the Eternal! Write new songs; sing them to Him with all your might! Gather with His faithful followers in joyful praise;

2.verse: Let all of Israel celebrate their Maker, their God, their friend; let the children of Zion find great joy in their true King.

3.verse: So let the music begin; praise His name—dance and sing to the rhythm of the tambourine, and to the tune of the harp.

4.verse: For the Eternal is listening, and nothing pleases Him more than His people; He raises up the poor and endows them with His salvation.

5.verse: Let His faithful followers erupt in praise, singing triumphantly wherever they are, even as they lie down for sleep in the evening.

6.verse: With the name of God and praise in their mouths, with a two-edged sword in their hands,

7.verse: Let them take revenge on all nations who deny God. Let them punish the peoples.

8.verse: Kings and nobles will be locked up, and their freedom will be bound in iron shackles.

9.verse: This judgment against them, decreed by a holy God, will be carried out. It’s an honor for all His faithful followers to serve Him. Praise the Eternal!

1.verse: Psalm 150 - If Psalm 150 is any indication, then the worship of the one True God ought to be full of life and energy. Consider what it must have looked and sounded like in those days: voices lifted, shouting for joy, trumpets blaring, stringed instruments playing, people dancing, pipes humming, tambourines keeping rhythm, cymbals crashing. There are times when worship ought to break out in joy. Is it possible that our worship is too quiet, too reserved, too structured? Praise the Eternal! Praise the True God inside His temple. Praise Him beneath massive skies, under moonlit stars and rising sun.

2.verse: Praise Him for His powerful acts, redeeming His people. Praise Him for His greatness that surpasses our time and understanding.

3.verse: Praise Him with the blast of trumpets high into the heavens, and praise Him with harps and lyres and the rhythm of the tambourines skillfully played by those who love and fear the Eternal. Praise Him with singing and dancing; praise Him with flutes and strings of all kinds!

4.verse: Praise Him with the blast of trumpets high into the heavens, and praise Him with harps and lyres and the rhythm of the tambourines skillfully played by those who love and fear the Eternal. Praise Him with singing and dancing; praise Him with flutes and strings of all kinds!

5.verse: Praise Him with crashing cymbals, loud clashing cymbals!

6.verse: No one should be left out; Let every man and every beast— every creature that has the breath of the Lord—praise the Eternal! Praise the Eternal! This doxology not only closes Book Five, but it also closes the entire Book of Psalms. Up until now, the songs in this book have reminded us of all the reasons we should praise God. Some songs have even commanded us to praise Him. But this closing remark takes the command to praise one step further: everything alive—humans, animals, and heaven’s creatures—must praise Him. Praise is what God created us to do; it is one of our highest purposes in life. So it is no wonder that the longest book of the Bible is purely devoted to helping us do just that.
